edu.ncsu.csc.itrust.dao.mysql

? DrugInteractionDAO

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ncsu.csc.itrust.dao.mysql.DrugInteractionDAO

  • public class DrugInteractionDAO
extends java.lang.Object
    Used for managing drug interactions. DAO stands for Database Access Object. All DAOs are intended to be reflections of the database, that is, one DAO per table in the database (most of the time). For more complex sets of queries, extra DAOs are added. DAOs can assume that all data has been validated and is correct. DAOs should never have setters or any other parameter to the constructor than a factory. All DAOs should be accessed by DAOFactory (@see DAOFactory) and every DAO should have a factory - for obtaining JDBC connections and/or accessing other DAOs.
    ??:
    Andy
    ????:
    http://www.fda.gov/Drugs/InformationOnDrugs/ucm142438.htm

      • reportInteraction

        public boolean reportInteraction(java.lang.String firstDrug,
                        java.lang.String secondDrug,
                        java.lang.String description)
                          throws DBException,
                                 iTrustException
        Adds a new drug interaction, returns whether or not the addition was successful. If the code already exists, an iTrustException is thrown.
        ??:
        firstDrug - The name of the first drug in an interaction.
        secondDrug - The name of the second drug in an interaction.
        description - Explanation of the drug interaction.
        ??:
        A boolean indicating success or failure.
        ??:
        DBException
        iTrustException

        ??:

        ??:
